text: Richard Harris Clarida (born May 18, 1957) is an American economist. He was the Vice Chair of the Federal Reserve from 2018 until 2022. Clarida studied his Bachelor of Science degree in economics from the University of Illinois and did his Master of Arts and Doctor of Philosophy degrees from Harvard University. == References == Category:1957 births Category:American economists Category:Columbia University faculty Category:Harvard University alumni Category:Living people Category:Vice Chairs of the Federal Reserve Category:Educators from Illinois
title: Richard Clarida
